boardgame.name: Don't Get Got!: Working From Home Edition
boardgame.description:
Work can be tough — even when you’re sitting on the sofa. Luckily, we’ve got just the thing to help brighten up your virtual office. A mini game designed to be played with your workmates, while you work from home.
You and your co-workers each start with six secret missions. The first player to complete three of their missions, wins.
Every single one of these missions involves tricking another player, and they’re all based around video conference calls. So, whether you’re in a 10 person Zoom meeting or a one-on-one Skype session, you better bring your A-game. There’s no telling what might be on the agenda.

boardgame.name: Alexander the Great: Alexander's Campaign from Macedonia to India
boardgame.description:
Alexander the Great is the second "historical" title of the One Page Games series.
It’s a quick game where you play the role of Alexander on his march from Macedonia to India, where he will meet the Indian army at the Hydaspes river (326BC).

The game uses the engine of Hannibal ad Portas with several changes introduced to better represent the campaigns of Alexander:

Companions special rules
Persian and Indian armies
Army Morale


New stratagems and events have been added to provide new challenges to the player.

–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Wars of Alexander the Great

boardgame.name: Shackleton Expanse Campaign Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

INTO THE UNKNOWN!

The Shackleton Expanse Campaign Guide for the Star Trek Adventures Roleplaying Game presents a thrilling, all-new area of the Beta Quadrant to explore: the Shackleton Expanse. Countless wonders and mysteries await within, including strange spatial phenomena that confuse sentient life-forms as well as starship sensors, ancient alien technologies powerful enough to move or obliterate entire star systems, dangerous new species to encounter, and so much more!

EXPLORE STRANGE NEW WORLDS! A detailed sandbox setting centered on the Shackleton Expanse and Starbase 364, the only jointly-run Federation-Klingon starbase.

SEEK OUT NEW LIFE AND NEW CIVILIZATIONS! Five new playable alien species, including the Orions and four species unique to the Shackleton Expanse.

BOLDLY GO WHERE NO ONE HAS GONE BEFORE! An epic 10-part campaign spanning the original series and The Next Generation eras, featuring the mysterious Tilikaal.

Guidance on how to create your own stories set in the Shackleton Expanse and beyond, across a century or more of the Star Trek timeline.
A large selection of NPCs found in and near the Expanse, including the command staff of Starbase 364 and many new life-forms.
Starship statistics for “hero” vessels as well as NPC spacecraft from a variety of alien species, both new and familiar.
Historical excerpts, personal logs, and intercepted communications, providing fresh perspectives on events related to the Shackleton Expanse.
All contents are adaptable for use with groups of pioneering Starfleet officers or fearless Klingon warriors.

boardgame.name: The Brinkwood Thicket
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Princess of Petals has been kidnapped!

During the annual Birthmonth celebration of Brightbloom the town of Brink is swarmed by giant wood spiders. The foul beasts attack no one, but they abscond with the maiden chosen to be this year’s festival princess. She must be saved, but the kidnapping goes much deeper than expected...

RC2: The Brinkwood Thicket is the second in the new Regulations Codex series from Mithgarthr Entertainment, focusing on gameplay using an Encyclopedia of Rules, but can be played with any OSR style game! For 4-6 character of levels 2-4. of the community.

boardgame.name: Shrdlu
boardgame.description:
A row of five cards is dealt out, some of which contain constraints like "only 1 of this letter" or "alphabetically earliest letter in the word". Players then race to think of a word that fits the cards dealt.

When the 15-card deck is exhausted, whoever called the most words wins the game.

boardgame.name: Schattendossier 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Wissen ist Macht – kaum ein Sprichwort trifft im Leben von Shadowrunnern mehr zu. Denn wenn du dich in Gefahr begibst, bist du mit dem richtigen Wissen immer im Vorteil. Du möchtest in den kampfgebeutelten Schatten von Marienbad aktiv werden? Dein nächster Auftrag führt dich in die Konzernwelt des Frankfurter Bankenvereins? Herr Schmidt will etwas für seine private Gemäldesammlung haben, und nun steckst du in den Tiefen des illegalen Kunsthandels? Du unternimmst eine Reise zu den mysteriösesten, magischen Orten der ADL und angrenzenden Ländern? Oder du wolltest schon immer mal zur Feuerwehr? Wissen ist Macht. Oder verlängert zumindest dein Leben.

Das Schattendossier 2 ist der zweite Sammelband der bisher erschienenen PDFs für die ADL für Shadowrun 6. In ihm sind die Datapulse für Feuerwehr, magische Orte, Kunstraub, den Frankfurter Bankenverein und Marienbad zusammengefasst, inklusive einer kleinen, exklusiven Erweiterung zur Norddeutschen Seenot-Rettungsgesellschaft. Das Schattendossier 2 ist streng limitiert und die einzelnen Bücher durchnummeriert.

boardgame.name: Empire in Ruins
Part 5 of The Enemy Within Campaign
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

After the events of The Horned Rat the heroes have won the respect and trust of many in Middenheim, but before they can capitalise on their renown the Empire descends into the turmoil of civil strife.A number of threats that the Characters may have thought far behind them reassert their influence. Icons of authority and leadership are found wanting, and the greatest nation in the Old World appears destined to shake itself to pieces.

Only by undertaking a dangerous journey can the Characters prevent the ruination of all they hold dear.

boardgame.name: Agent Badge
boardgame.description:
User summary:
Metal badge
boardgame.rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)

boardgame.name: Battle Ace
boardgame.description:
Theme: Your suit of 13 normal playing cards is an elite company of warriors with different combat strengths and movement rates.

Objective/Game Play: From a random layout on a board space, your cards move and attack the enemy warriors, taking as many as you can as you try to capture their king or stronghold. You can stack your cards to increase their combat score.

In Battle Ace, face-down spare cards form a playing "board" area and the two armies (hearts and spades) are shuffled then placed in two face-up rows at either end of this "board". A card or stack is then moved by the player on alternate turns.

Players choose just one action on their turn: Move, Stack. Attack, Pack

The game ends when either a king is killed/taken or a king reaches the opponent's back row. Bonus points are awarded for either of these.

The players add up the melee abilities (face-values of number cards, King/Queen/Jack = 10) plus any bonus points from achieving a win condition. Highest total wins.

Variations: There are optional rules for jokers, adding dice, campaigns and much more.

boardgame.name: Dossier: Sette e Culti
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:
DOSSIER: Sette e Culti è un’espansione per il gioco di ruolo #URBANHEROES che approfondisce le realtà religioso-spirituali del mondo di Terra Z.

English translation:
DOSSIER: Sects and Cults is an expansion for the #URBANHEROES role-playing game that explores the religious and spiritual realities of the world of Terra Z.

boardgame.name: Wild: Serengeti – Upgraded wooden tokens
boardgame.description: 91 silk printed wooden resource tokens. Includes 25 food meeples, 25 SFX meeples, 35 coin meeples and 6 lock meeples.

boardgame.description:
Do Not Upload Images




The publisher of this item has asked that no images of any media be uploaded, including representative images.Thank you for your cooperation.

boardgame.name: Haunted West
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's webpage:
From the creators of Harlem Unbound, Haunted West is a Weird West tabletop roleplaying game set after the American Civil War.

Haunted West is about hope through struggle. It is a game that amplifies the voices of the often overlooked people of the Old West, the people who have been whitewashed by history. Venture into an alternate history that imagines a post-American Civil War world where Reconstruction flourishes for many years, instead of meeting its abrupt end, and imagine a new reality with greater opportunities for all who inhabit the United States.

Step out of your door into the Haunted West. But, beware! It isn't for the faint of heart.

"If there is no struggle, there is no progress. Those who profess to favor freedom, and yet depreciate agitation, are men who want crops without plowing up the ground. They want rain without thunder and lightning. They want the ocean without the awful roar of its many waters. This struggle may be a moral one; or it may be a physical one; or it may be both moral and physical; but it must be a struggle. Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will."
—Frederick Douglass, 1857

HISTORY BELONGS TO ALL OF US.

This corebook has everything you need to explore the Old West, including:

An extensive historical account from prehistoric times through the last stagecoach robbery
The Ouroboros System, a modular three-tiered system powering your adventures using d100, degrees of success, and a unique Jacks mechanic
Haunted West: Reconstruction, an imaginative alternate history
Robust Weird West content including magicks, creatures, mechanics, and more
The Night of the Aerostat, a thrilling adventure set in the Weird West
An in-depth city-building process for creating the setting you want
Lifepath character creation to build characters firmly entrenched in the world
Twelve Paragon categories enabling you to create any type of player character you choose
Haunted West World, a Powered by the Apocalypse hack


WEIRD, WEIRDER, OR WEIRDEST?

Make your West as Weird as you want the way you want (if you want). Plug in magic, the Mythos, steam tech, mad science, dinosaurs, or even aliens and flying saucers. Haunted West gives you the tools you need to make your definition of "Weird West" a reality.

Battle traitorous rebels as a Black gadgeteer with your rifle and jetpack, rustle cattle as a Chinese drover while keeping the dinosaurs at bay, combat a legion of undead monsters as an Indigenous gunslinger, or traverse the Oregon trail as a Jewish homesteader while being haunted by the specters of those who perished along the way. You have the power to tell your story; you have the power to tell the American story.

boardgame.name: Triveneto (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Ticket to Ride Triveneto is a fan-produced map of Triveneto (the land of Venice) by Giovanni Salamon (Gh48). The map can be played with the original rules of TtR Europe or with the TtR Triveneto's custom rules.

TtR Triveneto is designed by Gh48 and the digital version was made by Gh48 and Natascia Torres with the help of RDN_ROXAS

boardgame.name: Dickory
boardgame.description:
Be the first to get rid of your cards in this climbing game with shifting ranks!

The game is in the vein of Dai Fugō (**Millionaire**) and involves playing cards from your hands in singles, doubles, triples, quads, or 3-card runs.

There are no suits, and ranks can shift by clever manipulation of a "conveyor belt" queue of cards. Whichever rank is in the rightmost position of the conveyor belt is the highest rank, and the ordering of the remaining ranks shifts according to a circular ranking.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Microscopic
boardgame.description:
Welcome to a world invisible to the naked eye, where cells evolve and compete to grow into the biggest, strongest, and fastest living organisms.

You will start off small and slow and weak. Collect enough genes to begin laying down cells, then choose which adaptations to focus on and which organisms will give you the best edge.

As you grow, you will need to make sacrifices to get to the next level, but everything ramps up as you race to the end, claiming the most organisms to win.

During their turn a player plays cards from their hand to their tableau and finishes by drawing. The game ends when any player claims three organisms (two for a 4-player game), which is also the win condition.

There is also a solitaire and co-op version with similar game play.

boardgame.name: Council of Six
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Bound in a twisting wheel within a helm, 6 heads of fallen council members, betrayed by foul heretics, now walk together with one body to seek revenge~!

-A NEW CLASS for MÖRK BORG-

Rotate your head each day to gain new benefits.

boardgame.name: Ticket to Fly (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
boardgame.description:
"This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only."

Ticket to Fly is a French language expansion for Les Adventiers du rail. Set in the US, it allows for flight between major US cities, using custom cards and TtR mechanics.

Journeys are:

Los Angeles–Chicago

San Francisco–Atlanta

Portland–Nashville

Los Angeles–Miami

Vancouver–Montreal

Los Angeles–New York

Seattle–New York

boardgame.name: The Vile Bile-Rider
boardgame.description:
From the description:

First you hear the sound of skittering legs moving across bark and log.

Then the godless stench. Then the haunting moans of ecstacy. Then the dying trees part.

And then it is too late....

For the VILE BILE-RIDER HAS COME~!

boardgame.name: Sisters of Hate
boardgame.description:
From the description:

-Here's an Enemy compatible with MÖRK BORG to use for gameplay.

The SISTERS OF HATE wander the lands, twisted by sorrow and despair.

Once their words were meant to spread the truth of SHE but now they brandish the power to turn brother against brother, self against self.

boardgame.description:

Travel the Hoddle Grid or see the sites in St. Kilda. Your favorite train game now travels through Melbourne! by Peter McIntyre

boardgame.name: Fenix (No. 3, 2021 - English only)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fenix #3, 2021 is all about CITY ADVENTURES, with a brief history by Graeme Davis and an introduction to the White Death and the Guards of Grimsand by Pete Nash. You do not want to miss out on the interview Rooking all over the World, to find out more about The Rookery and their plans. All ends with a comic strip about Bernard the Barbarian and his encounter with Rapunzel.

Rooking all over the World – 4 pages interview with The Rookery about their upcoming plans

Earlier this year a cryptic message started to appear online. “What is the Rookery?” it said and further investigation revealed that luminary Graeme Davis, famed for his work on Warhammer Fantasy Rookplay … Roleplay … was involved, as was Andy Law, one of the former architects of the fourth edition of said game. And the illustrious illustrator Mark Gibbons, super-editor Lindsey Law and writer extraordinaire Andy Leask were on the team as well. The teasing was profound and the details scarce but now Fenix can reveal the designers behind the scene and reveal to you, the esteemed reader, what the Rookery really is. I got some time with the gang and after some initial light prompting the floodgates opened. We are proud to present to you … the Rookery!

White Death – 4 pages about the Guards of Grimsand, a Wretched Hive of Scum and Villainy by Pete Nash
Pete Nash keeps exploring the many perils of Monster Island to Mythras. The colony of Port Grimsand is a small coastal town, a tenuous foothold on the tropical hell that is Monster Island. Its inhabitants are restricted to living within the periphery of the ancient ruins of Kapala; a city built aeons before the colonists arrived and a place shunned by native savages, who treat it with superstitious dread. When continents sank back beneath the oceans, half of the city and the shoulder of Mount Yoormiphazreth, upon which it was built, fell into the waves. In this article, you will uncover some of its secrets.

City Settings – a brief 5 pages history by Graeme Davis
City adventures have always been my favorites. The first city setting I roleplayed in was the city of Sanctuary from Thieves’ World, and it changed the whole way I looked at roleplaying. What follows is necessarily a very incomplete and partial survey of some of the city settings I have encountered over the course of my roleplaying career. Since there are dozens, if not hundreds, of city supplements on the market, in all languages and across all genres, this list is highly personal — as are my comments — but it does give a broad overview of how city supplements for roleplaying games developed, what kind of content was standard at a given time, and what was new. Perhaps it even points a direction for the future. What is certainly true is that city supplements are almost as old as roleplaying games themselves, and city adventures have never been more popular.

Bernard the Barbarian meets Rapunzel
New comic from Åke Rosenius.

boardgame.name: Fenix (No. 4, 2021 - English only)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fenix #4, 2021 is all about JOY and HAPPINESS. Graeme Davis goes into the light and dark sides of joy in gaming. In our first gaming article for the brand new game Troubleshooters, we are introduced to the The Laugh-O-Tron, a weird science weapon putting a hahaha into your battles. Pete Nash goes another route, as he introduces us to the Sisterhood of Joiry; presenting three swordswomen born at the dawn of fantasy.

C’mon Get Happy - 4 pages – Graeme Davis on the Light and Dark Sides of Joy in Gaming

So sang Dr. House in a memorably sinister dream sequence in a 2011 episode of the popular medical drama. The performance and direction gave the idea of happiness itself unexpectedly sinister twist, and with the right presentation happiness can add a surprisingly effective level of menace to a roleplaying adventure as well.

The Laugh-O-Tron – Putting “A Hahaha” into Weird Science - 1 page article to Troubleshooters

The Octopus’ standard anti-personnel weapon, the disneuro ray, has two major disadvantages: it requires a lot of power to shut down and re-boot a person’s nervus system, and it can only disable a single target at a time. The Octopus scientist #621 (Octopus members are referred to with numbers, not names, for security rea-sons) invented an alternative: the Laugh-o-tron!

Sisterhood of Joiry – 4 pages about the Origin of Swordswomen born at the Dawn of Fantasy by Pete Nash

In this issue of Fenix we are encouraged to focus upon joy. Since I am, by nature, a grumpy old man turned bitter by years of witnessing frail human nature, I admit to finding little joy in the world of today. A place where friends turn away from friends due to election or referendums, families are torn asunder by new ideologies, and once stable nations stumble towards civil disorder. However, as the Pythons once sang, ‘Always look on the bright side of life!’

My personal bright side, the place I can always go to simply enjoy myself in pure escapism, has always been roleplaying games. Perhaps I am simply addicted to the interplay of storylines, player camaraderie and not least, the inherent gamble of a dice roll. Or maybe, it is the one place I can fantasise that I can be a true hero and actually defeat evil, rather than watch the real world head towards a dystopia I am helpless to prevent.

Whilst I could churn out a tedious article about theoretical Game Mastering methods to help roleplayers enjoy themselves to the fullest, or rewards to gift their characters, I shall instead look at the foundational female protagonists of fantasy fiction. Namely Jirel of Joiry and her sisters, who broke the mould of male dominated action adventurers.

So without further ado, please enjoy!

boardgame.name: 100 Artifacts for Modern Settings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You need a magic item or an ancient relic for your scenario, but you haven't prepared anything? You need a starting idea to create an adventure? This list is made for you!

100 Artifacts for Modern Settings contains 100 brief descriptions of magical objects and ancient relics that you can use in your games based on modern settings. Each result consists of an artifact name, a brief description and a unique power.

boardgame.name: 100 Background Town Events Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you find that your cities all look the same, that they are boring, and that they only serve to restore your characters' hp between two adventures?

Cities are the base camp of your characters between two expeditions. But that's not why they should not be used! If you want to make your towns an unforgettable, unique place with details or mysteries, 100 TOWN BACKGOUND EVENTS is for you! You will find in a few pages 100 events to integrate into your urban backgrounds that will allow you to spice up the adventure.

boardgame.name: 100 Bounties to Hunt Across the Galaxy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

100 bounties to hunt across the galaxy contains 100 adventure seed ideas that you can use in your space opera based games.

Highly compatible with the star wars universe, each result consists of a character to hunt (name and race), a crime committed, a reward and a planet or a sector where the bounty was last seen.

This product includes 100 castles and strongholds that can be inserted in any location.

100 CYBERPUNK CORPORATIONS contains 100 corporations that fit into futuristic or cyberpunk settings. Roll 1d100 and read the corresponding entry.

100 Fantasy Landmarks CR 1-4

100 Random Space Encounters contains 100 adventure seed ideas that you can use in your space opera based games.

Highly compatible with the star wars universe, each result consists of different things that the characters may encounter in space, especially when exiting a hyperspace jump.

100 Random Alien Species contains 100 species of aliens you may encounter in space opera based games.

Some forms are evolved while others are strange animals intended to enrich your backgrounds.

Highly compatible with the Star Wars universe, each result consists of an alien species name and a brief description.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The taverns are the unmissable events of the fantasy. Make this place unique thanks to 100 TAVERN QUIRKS. Thanks to this book, you will be able to transform your taverns into unique places and offer your players an unforgettable experience.

Roll a d100 and refer to the table on the next page. Then adapt the result to your desire. The result can simply serve as a simple background or be a real challenge to the plot.

Compatible with all fantasy RPGs.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you find that your cities all look the same, that they are boring, and that they only serve to restore your characters' hp between two adventures?

Cities are the base camp of your characters between two expeditions. But that's not why they should not be used! If you want to make your towns an unforgettable, unique place with details or mysteries, 100 TOWN BACKGOUND EVENTS is for you! You will find in a few pages 100 events to integrate into your urban backgrounds that will allow you to spice up the adventure.

boardgame.name: 100 Weird Houses and Other Spooky Places
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You need a haunted house for your script, but you haven't prepared anything? You need a starting idea to create an adventure? You want to find a source of inspiration or a new idea to launch your campaign? This list is made for you!

100 WEIRD HOUSES AND OTHER SPOOKY PLACES contains 100 short descriptions of haunted houses and other weird places to use in your games based on modern settings. Each result consists of a house or place name, a real US city where the house is located and a brief description of what makes this house weird.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cowboy Name Random Generator is a simple and fast generator of old west/weird west characters.

Need an NPC instantly? Lack of inspiration to name your character? Cowboy Name Random Generator will help you to find a quick name for any man or woman, famous or not from the far west.

boardgame.name: Data Fortress Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Load up your cyberdeck and assault the data fortress!

Cyberpunk Data fortress Generator is a companion volume to create exciting data fortresses for any system.

This book is based on the premise that a computer system can be more than just a succession of uni-dimensional "door/monster/treasure" levels. Each data system should be built according to a logic that can provide an interesting game experience for the hacker.

boardgame.name: Escape from Pumpkin World
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As you return from a fancy dress party, you find yourself transported to the Pumpkin World, a strange place located between the realm of the dead and the world of the living. Some of its inhabitants are dangerous while others are downright zany.

Escape from Pumpkin World is a quick and easy adventure role-playing game for all fans of Buffy the Vampire Slayer or Tim Burton.
...
The booklet is in PocketMod format so that you only need to fold it to form a mini 8-page booklet in 4.25" x 2.75" format from a single sheet of paper.

boardgame.name: Ghost Hunters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inspired by the famous movie Ghosbusters, here is the quick and easy adventure role-playing game for hunters of ghosts, ectoplasms and all kinds of gods and demons.

The basic rules of Ghost Hunters have been designed to make reading, creating characters and starting a game as quickly as possible. Ghost Hunters can also be played solo by easily assigning characters to their tasks.
...
The booklet is in PocketMod format so that you only need to fold it to form a mini 8-page booklet in 4.25" x 2.75" format from a single sheet of paper.

boardgame.name: Frieza's Mercenaries
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Frieza is dead!

He was killed on an obscure planet at the far end of the galaxy.

Deprived of his almighty master, his empire sinks into anarchy: wars of succession, rebellious slaves, raids on wealthy planets.... The golden age of space piracy has begun!

In Frieza's Mercenaries, you embody powerful aliens, powerful enough to conquer planets all by yourself!

boardgame.name: Super Powers: 100 Random Characters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Super powers: 100 RANDOM CHARACTERS contains 100 characters with superpowers.

Sometimes you have to create a character "on the fly". Whether it's an NPC that your players are about to meet or a random grunt, this book will help you create scenarios, all you need is a spark of lightning to stimulate your imagination.

boardgame.name: Star Rush
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're a space smuggler, a criminal wanted by every police force in the galaxy, but also a romantic adventurer with an irresistible smile. At the controls of your Cobra MKIII, you are always caught up in the most perilous adventures. You and your crew have agreed to deliver a mysterious suitcase on Zeta Prime. But hurry! You have only 30 days to complete your mission.

boardgame.name: Star Rush Adventure Randomizer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This gives additional material to add depth to Star Rush.

You will find:


Tables to generate planets
Specific character classes
Rare artifacts
Stuff to improve your ship and equip your characters


As a bonus, a quick wreck/ruin exploration generator is included.

boardgame.name: Monster Trick Generator to Lure Your Players
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do your players know the monster manual by heart?

Of course, they tell you that they only flipped through a few pages, just to admire the illustrations. But in reality you know that they have mentally photographed all the stats of the monsters!

Good for you! That means they are captivated by the game!

But on the other hand, the encounters turn into nothing more than probability calculations.

boardgame.name: Maze Masters: Barbarians of Kratos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Surrounded by the Roarwind Mounts is the Maze, an arena where Lords resolve their conflicts by sending heroes to face each other in a battle royale death match. Fame and Fortune awaits the one who will overcome the perils of the Maze and emerge from the depths of the earth brandishing the Emblem of Victory.

boardgame.name: Maze Masters: Templars of Lightown
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Surrounded by the Roarwind Mounts is the Maze, an arena where Lords resolve their conflicts by sending heroes to face each other in a battle royale death match. Fame and Fortune awaits the one who will overcome the perils of the Maze and emerge from the depths of the earth brandishing the Emblem of Victory.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Kingdom Random Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fantasy Kingdom Random Generator is a tool that will help you create game worlds quickly.


You didn't prepare for the session?
You want to take the players to a nearby one-shot kingdom?
Running out of ideas?


Fantasy Kingdom Random Generator is the perfect tool to create a setting.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Potions Random Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fantasy Potion Random Generator is a tool that will help you to quickly create potions for your adventurers. This tool is generic and works with any fantasy game world.


Do you think all potions look the same?
Do potions become random objects?


Using the tables included in the chapters of this book, you can quickly create unique and mysterious potions.

boardgame.name: Galactic Bounties Random Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Galactics Bounties Random Generator is a tool that will help you to quickly create bounties to hunt for your players.


You're playing bounty hunters?
You need a bounty and you haven't prepared anything?
Out of inspiration?


With the help of the tables included in the chapters of this book, you will be able to quickly determine the essential aspects of your bounties.

boardgame.name: Haunted House Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a haunted house? Haunted House Generator is a tool that will help you to quickly create a mysterious place for your players. Using the charts included in the chapters of this book, you will be able to easily determine the essential aspects of your haunted house.

boardgame.name: In Flames!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Flames is a mini background, a one-page sandbox module.

For a few weeks now, a gigantic wall of flames has been burning near the small town of Sirklet. The road is completely cut in two by the fire, prohibiting any access to the Kingdom. The town is completely isolated... except by travelling through the haunted lands of the Scarred Belt or through the dangerous hills of the Claw-Blade Ogres!

A second page, offers all the means to play a solo adventure in this background. I propose you to play as DURGAR FIREBEARD, a suicidal dwarf firefighter, sent on a special mission to put out the fire. You will find in one page, a lot of tables and advices to lead this solo adventure.

boardgame.name: Ghosts of the Lantern Path
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The souls have awakened and threaten to bring chaos to the region! Already, the slaves assigned to the construction of the great observatory are refusing to work.

boardgame.name: Rise of the Slime
boardgame.description:
Source: The Publisher Website.

Be the hero that no-one saw coming. Help Slime defy the odds by playing insanely powerful cards in this charming, relaxing and strategic deckbuilding adventure.

User Summary

Rise of the Slime is an indie roguelike deckbuilder where battles take place on a 2D map so that positioning is important in addition to cardplay.

boardgame.name: The Sound of Midnight
boardgame.description:
Deck building card game. Solo to unlimited player. Lovecraft-like themed. Standard game allows for around 4+ players. Add another artifact pack to allow additional 4+ more players. Game can be played with players having their own packs. Players can join any active game at the start of any round. No need to wait for end of game to join.

This is a 2 pack game, both packs are needed for the full game.
Book of Artifacts
Book of incantations

Casting "Bewitched" Incantation cards will affect everyone including the caster. There are "Aura" Incantation cards that help protect from "Bewitched" cards.

Tournament style also available, in the rules.

boardgame.name: Outcast 2
boardgame.description: Horror

boardgame.name: MX vs ATV Legends
boardgame.description: Sports

boardgame.name: Superpower 3
Superpower III
boardgame.description: Superpower 3 is a modern geopolitical sim in a planet Earth setup.

boardgame.name: Jagged Alliance 3
boardgame.description: In Jagged Alliance 3, select from a huge cast of mercenaries all with their own unique personalities, quirks, and backstories.

boardgame.name: Spongebob Squarepants: The Cosmic Shake
boardgame.description: Cartoon

boardgame.name: ZU Tiles: Hime Starter Set 2
boardgame.description:
ZU Tiles: Hime is a strategic tile placement game based loosely on the creatures of the Chinese Zodiac. Players choose a creature (or creatures) to build customized decks around in order to out think and out play their opponent(s). Players earn points by creating patterns of “compatible squares” using creatures or by battling and capturing opposing creatures. The first player to 12 points wins! Think Collectable Card Game meets Dominoes...but with amazing anime inspired art and super fun tile interactions.

ZU Tiles: Hime is a quick and easy game for the whole family, focusing more on its unique compatibility mechanics than it does on combat. We're hoping you have more fun and more genuine enjoyment of playing vs. the sometimes cutthroat competition that other more competitive deck building games can become. Relax. Take your time. Smile more. Laugh a bit. Enjoy yourself.

Starter Set 1 consists of the Pig, Rabbit, Ram, Tiger, Horse, and Dog tiles.
Starter Set 2 consists of the Dragon, Snake, Rooster, Rat, Ox, and Monkey tiles.

boardgame.name: HEKKspedisjon: Ekspedisjon Europa
boardgame.description:
HEKKspedisjon - Ekspedisjon Europa is a competition driven, mid level strategy game.

You play as one of six characters, traveling around Europe. Each character has his own strengths and weaknesses. You will encounter people that may help or hinder you along the way and you will rely on getting your hands on the best expedition-gear to stay in front. Both regular shops and the black market is available to you as long as you have cash in hand. Both competitions and individual expedition-goals will drive you towards your goal, but don't underestimate the power of gaining knowledge of places and people you encounter.

Each turn consists of 4 phases.
First phase is "Adjusting hunger". The player adjusts their hunger bar according to their placement on the board.
Second phase is "Shopping phase". Players may do repairs on their vehicle (if applicable) or buy food. Players may also buy items from the black market (if in a city) or from the shop.
Third phase is "Action / work". The player chooses whether they will do a job to earn money or draw a city event/travel event card.
Fourth phase is "Movement / work" The player chooses whether they do a job to earn money or if they want to move towards their next expedition goal.

The game ends when the first person enters the "End" position on "The winning track".
To win you need to collect expedition points and/or knowledge points. The first player to gain enough points to enter the "End" position of "The winning track" is the winner of the game.

boardgame.name: City Break
boardgame.description:
In British English, a city break is a short holiday spent in a city. City breaks are perfect for anyone looking to relax and get away from it all for a few days, as well as seeking out authentic experiences. City Break is about your memories that you are proud of and like to tell people about, and the roles you adopt when you talk about your past travels!
You come back from your city breaks very enthusiastic and ready to share them with others. Your memories turn into posts on social media or face-to-face narrations about what you have observed, encountered, or undergone. You have to announce your adventures to the world! And you don't usually tell trivial stories!
Who are you when you boast about where you went and what you did or saw? When you talk passionately about the arts, you turn into a Culture Creature. You are also the Royalty Buff who devours biographies of kings and queens and enjoys visiting their castles and palaces. There is an inner Happy Foodie inside you who loves mentioning unique and memorable food and drink experiences. Your social media profiles reveal a Nature Lover who marvels at the mysteries of nature and appreciates natural beauty. Only a Sights Seeker would plan ahead for trips to the world's busiest sights and landmarks. Your followers can't wait to watch live the Motion Addict who loves public transport, the best way to connect to the city.

City Break is a one-of-a-kind puzzle-solving board game specifically designed for a pair of gamers. What makes City Break truly awesome is that it manages to achieve an incredible strategic depth in a two-player setting. City Break is about adapting to new information, making the right choices at the right time, and solving the puzzle of the combinations of available digit-tiles, cards, and action tokens. The game gets more and more intense with each played card, while you have to keep an eye on your opponent's playing space so as not to be surprised by suddenly ending the game!

Players use cards to fill six columns with memories, creating narratives about their past travels. They need to make sure that their narratives are credible, so they must bring them into a state of equilibrium or harmony. The credibility of a narrative is determined by its 3 sub-columns of values. Equilibrium is when a part of your narrative is in balance with the other two parts taken together (for example, B = A + C). Harmony is when two parts of your narrative balance each other out (for example, B = C).

You pursue a diversity of interests when you travel, and you develop new personas when you talk about where you went and what you did or saw. Each of the 6 outlined columns of cards of your tableau corresponds to a + or = represented at the bottom of the 90 personas. Each persona has a combination of 2 + and/or = indicating the 2 narratives you need to be credible. + symbols indicate which narratives you need to bring into equilibrium. = symbols indicate which narratives you need to bring into harmony.

At the end of your turn, if all 6 of your outlined columns of cards either have complete narratives placed on them or are disabled, your opponent gets one final turn. The game then ends and players calculate their final scores.

Your goal is to score the most Victory Points by assembling long credible narratives, developing personas, achieving target values, matching images, and earning titles. Are you quick-witted enough to deal with changing conditions, elements of randomness, and unpredictable opponents? Find out in City Break!

boardgame.name: Glory Islands
boardgame.description:
The year is 1660. The pirate ship crews are determined to find out who is the best captain amongst the pirates.

Glory Islands features easy-to-learn rules and fast, simple turns! You must outwit your opponents to claim fame and fortune. It has two different game boards and also includes a mini-expansion in the main game box.

Glory Islands is played over a series of rounds in which players simultaneously play sailing cards from their hands. The card values define the turn order, how far ships can move on the board, and where a player’s pirates may be placed on the board. Depending on where they are placed, pirates may receive glory, treasure tokens, or barrels. The cards may also provide bonus actions that players can use to gain an advantage over their opponents. When pirates occupy all of the spaces on an island, the player with the most pirates on that island will gain the most glory.

The game is over when one or more pirate ships have completed the route around the islands. The player with the most glory is crowned the "King of the Pirates"!

Title: Glory Islands Publisher: Rio Grande Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Uradalom
boardgame.description:
The game takes place in the medieval Europe where the players lead their estates as landlords. They must hurry with afforestation, regulation of rivers, and cultivating the fields to build a nicer and richer manor.

Each player rolls his 6 dice, then chooses one of them and draws the area corresponding to his number/colour on the map, then passes the other dice to the left neighbour using the dice holder and chooses one of the 5 dice he has, then passes this one and so on. When you run out of dice, the round is over and the next round begins in the same way. The game ends when all players have completed their map, i.e. filled in all the squares.

The player who scores the most points from building ponds, plough, forest, river, house wins. Each area has a different scoring system.

There are 2 variants of the game, one is a more tactical while the other one is faster. During the game common and hidden goal cards can be used optionally.

boardgame.name: Time's Up!: Harry Potter
boardgame.description:
The magical universe of Harry Potter meets the frantic and hilarious one of Time's up!

With Time’s Up!, you have 30 seconds and 3 rounds to guess the most words!

In the first round, you describe the cards without saying what is written there; in the second, make the same cards guess with a single word; in the third, mimic them to your teammates!

boardgame.name: Inventions: Evolution of Ideas
boardgame.description:
Since the beginning of the times, humanity had a permanent search for new ideas and their development. Their genius made them stand out from the other animals. Those ideas when invented become the base of evolution. By virtue of humanity’s nature as a toolmaker, humans have therefore been technologists from the beginning.

Inventions follow humanity’s greatest ideas and Inventions and places their power in the hands of the players to evolve their societies through times.
Inventions uses cards to simulate those ideas and inventions through time. Cards bring ideas that must be invented. Once invented they are shared with the world and all involved citizens spread the good news into the world while their ownership is claimed. Once developed, the inventions advance the technology, economy, and culture of societies and makes them progress. If shared, it boosts its power even more by allowing them to be used by other societies. Players leverage point-to-point movement on a board which is a world map containing dynamically changing worker placement locations.

Inventions are a tactical game with a long-term strategic plan. The player with the most progressed and strongest society wins the game. The strongest society is decided by Invention Points.

boardgame.name: Crafty Puggles
boardgame.description:
The late Viscount Pennington of Meyersbury has hidden his invaluable treasure in the gardens of his sprawling mansion. Many treasure hunters have tried to find it and have failed. That doesn’t mean all is lost! You’re a trainer of some crafty puggles - cute, cuddly, treasure-sniffing critters with a nose for all things bling. Can you guide them to the hidden treasure? Let’s dig to win BIG!

Crafty Puggles is a tile placement and path building game that will transform your family game nights! Kids will learn and master basic fractions, pattern recognition, strategy, planning and creativity to guide their puggles to the ultimate treasure! It isn’t always a walk in the park because there are tons of twists and turns. It’s fun and different every time you play!

In Crafty Puggles, you are treasure hunters guiding your trained puggles to dig their way to the hidden treasure. Your goal is to lay path tiles in your garden grove and help your puggle reach the treasure. You must also pay attention to what opponents are doing and strategically prevent them from finishing their paths.

The game board is divided into four garden groves, one for each player. Each garden grove consists of 20 squares in 4 rows and 5 columns. The treasure is located in the central treasure square. You create a path on the board by placing path tiles on the squares in your garden grove and connecting the muddy parts only. A path can also be blocked by the hound.

Every player starts with 1 puggle den and 1 puggle pawn of their choice. Place your puggle pawn at the start square of your puggle den mat. You keep path tiles you collect during the game in the Banked Tiles area. you can bank a maximum of 3 tiles. Dice roles will help you place your tiles, rotate your tiles, move your puggle and activate powers.

The first player to create an unblocked path from the start square to the central treasure square wins the game!

boardgame.name: Dominion: Allies
Dominion: Bondgenoten
Dominion: Verbündete
도미니언: 굳건한 동맹
boardgame.description:
It's a celebration! People are dancing in the streets, and riding horses through the dance halls. You've finally formed an alliance with the barbarians to the north. Instead of the streets running red with blood, they'll run, well, the usual color — let's not focus on what color the streets run. The point is, there's peace. Sure, negotiations were tricky. The barbarians are uncouth; they have no five-second rule and stick out the wrong finger when drinking tea. There are perks, too, though. They've given you skulls to drink mead out of and spices to get rid of the skull aftertaste. And you've given them stuff in return: forks, mirrors, pants. It's great for everyone. And with this treaty out of the way, you can get to work on your other neighbors. Soon, all the allies will be yours.

Dominion: Allies, the 14th expansion in the Dominion series, contains 400 cards, with 31 new Kingdom card piles that contain allies who will do favors for you and split piles that you can rotate.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dino Quest
boardgame.description:
Your dinosaur family has just moved into Prehistoric Park, a lovely marshy nook. Now, you must explore the park, gain resources and settle in. The first to collect all resources will make this their abode. The Quest is on!

Dino Quest is a resource collection and management game. In Dino Quest, you collect resources to help your dinosaur family settle in prehistoric park. You’re competing with other players to be the first to collect these resources and sometimes even grabbing some from them!

The game has 15 survival cards. Each card lists the resources players must collect during the game. When a player collects the exact quantities of each resource listed on the survival card, they immediately win the game.

There are 3 dice in the game, one number dice and two power dice. When you roll the number dice, you can collect any 1, 2 & 3 resource tokens. When collecting tokens you can either collect all of the same resource or different resources. There are 2 power dice, both have 3 symbols on them: spin, grab and double it. The action spinner lets you perform special actions. You can spin the spinner only if you roll two spins or a spin and a double it.

Your turn begins by rolling all 3 dice. Keep aside any one dice of your choice and resolve the other two. When collecting tokens from the resource bank, you must collect them one at a time without looking! If you collect the quantity mentioned of any 1 resource on the survival card, it does not mean that you ‘lock’ that particular resource. Opponents can still grab tokens off you and reduce your quantity. When grabbing resources from opponents you must always pick the top most token from any pile. Once you’ve performed all actions, your turn ends. If at the end of a turn you have the exact quantity of all resources listed on the survival card, you win the game. Otherwise the game continues.

boardgame.name: Gates of Aleppo
boardgame.description: In this documentary web game, play through the Syrian civil war in a gruesome battle started to rage
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 A MAZE. Awards Most Amazing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Delicious
boardgame.description:
Spend the afternoon in your rooftop or backyard garden. Relax while enjoying this artful game of picking, pairing, and planting fruits and vegetables. Grow your plants in whatever container you can. Wheelbarrows, boots, suitcases – use anything you can to grow delicious eats! Will you create the most delicious garden?

Over the course of a game of Delicious, players fill their respective gardens with fruits and vegetables by sketching them based on cards and tokens that are revealed in the community area. Players take their turns sketching simultaneously each round as these plants are revealed. Earn the most points by planting fruits and vegetables in your makeshift containers and planters.

A game lasts 12 rounds. Every round, 2 Vegetable cards are flipped (1 from each deck) and a Fruit / Tool token is placed on each card. Each player then decides to use one or both cards (and their tokens), given certain restrictions. When you use a card and token, you mark your Garden and Play sheets, trying to get different combinations of fruits and vegetables.

The cards in the middle are common, but players place them in different containers within their garden setting up different combinations and scoring opportunities. Bonus tools and special powers mean that no two gardens are ever alike.

After 12 rounds, the player with the highest score wins.
- If there is a tie, the player whose fruit planter score is higher wins.
- If there is still a tie, the player who has marked the most First Potter Bonus icons wins.

boardgame.name: Lasuf Futbol
boardgame.description:
A soccer-themed card game:

On their turn, each player must play a soccer player cards with the colors red, yellow, green and blue. As soon as he draws a goal of a color, he must play that card and defend it with soccer player cards of the same color.

His rivals must use the color cards to try to score a goal in a same color goal. The player who receives three goals in his goal is eliminated, the last one left in play is the winner.

It has several cards more related to the real sport, which are applied to offer variations and a minimum of strategy.

boardgame.name: Omnia Collectable Deckbuliding Game
boardgame.description:
OMNIA is a collectable deckbuilding game in which each player contributes a portion of the cards used for each game.
When the game starts, each player has a ‘’Player Deck” identical to each other player. As the game progresses, players use Source cards to purchase other cards from the Shop Zone and add them to their Player Decks. Players then use these cards to battle with other players, and fight to build the deck with the highest Prestige!

Players can collect cards, and build ‘’Flavor Decks’’ of their own to change the pool of cards that can appear in the Shop Zone over the course of a game. In this way players can not only increase the chances of a card appearing, but also gives players a chance to try out each other’s cards, to discover new strategies, and to find new cards to include in their own Flavor Deck in future games.

New cards are released regularly in booster sets, accompanied by a themed, pre-constructed, 2-player "Intro packs" that give new players a quick, and easy way to get started! Each Intro Pack includes 2 ready to play Flavor Decks, and 2 Player Decks

OMNIA Collectable Deckbuilding Game is for 2 or more players ages 14 and up, but is best played with 4 players

boardgame.name: 100 Overheard Cyber City Chatter V 13.0
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The city overwhelms the senses. Neon against rainy black sky, reflecting in the puddles. Smells of things out of the sewers mix with the deep fried offerings of street vendors. Stale sweat so heavy in the air you can taste it. The most overwhelming of all is the sound… especially the endless sea of chatter. This list provides 100 random things that a group of heroes might hear in a cyberpunk city setting. Some things are worth taking note of, other things are just verbal garbage.

boardgame.name: 50 Pirate Era Ghosts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different ghosts that haunt a historical or fantasy pirate setting. Included in each entry are the following: First and last name (and title for some), gender, age at the time of death, how many years ago that they died, and details about their life and death.

Some of the entries are directly related to piracy while others are related to the communities that surround the coast.

boardgame.name: LoveChoice
boardgame.description:
User Summary

LoveChoice is a dating simulation game and visual novel with a focus on interactivity and choice. Featuring three unique stories with multiple endings for each, players will make a number of choices as they play through each scenario. Those choices will affect how each story plays out as well as which ending they'll see. The game places emphasis on treating its subject matter with realism and ultimately asks the player, "do you know what love is?"

boardgame.name: Don't Touch this Button!
boardgame.description:
User Summary

In Don't Touch this Button!, players wake up in a mysterious 3D environment unsure of how or why they are there. It consists of a series of rooms, each with a puzzle that must be solved in order to progress. Players must push the correct button or buttons in order to proceed. All the while the game's unreliable narrator actively tries to deceive or confuse players. The puzzles become more difficult as the game goes on, and the level of danger associated with each room increases as well. Played in first person, Don't Touch this Button adheres to a minimalist approach, opting instead to focus on the puzzles and story.

boardgame.name: Adventurers Spellbook
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book

Spells

The heart and soul of the magic system in Castles & Crusades are the spells. And now, for the first time we have gathered the spells for C&C into one place. From a wide variety of sources, we have compiled them all in one place. They come from the Players Handbook, Adventurers Backpack, Players Guide to Aihrde, Amazing Adventures, Hallowed Oracle Players Guide & Elemental Spells! A mountainous collection for all the spellcasters.

Rune Spells

You will also find a complete collection of all the Codices of Rune Spells within these pages, from the Shadow Runes to the Four Pillars. They are all here. Over 200 new rune spells for your Rune Mark and Castles & Crusades game!

Chromatic Mage

It also includes the tables and information on the oft discussed but hard to find Chromatic Mage!

boardgame.name: Monsters Arena
boardgame.description:
Monsters Arena is a battle game for children. Each player take a deck (they are different for each monster) and in own turn plays a card. On the card there are values for attack and defense. Simply subtract values and damage enemy of correspondence result. At start of the game each monster has ten life. The monster who remains with life at the end will be the winner.
If you play more than two players you have also to choose which opponent attack.
Each monster has also some asymmetrical powers that can help during the battle.
In the end the Arena has special rules to be applied each turn.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ground Assault
boardgame.description:
On the modern battlefield, military units face off against each other, the terrain, and the elements. Carve out the best strategy to navigate the terrain and build structures to control land. But be on your guard! Pitfalls await you around every turn, and your entire strategy can quickly unravel…

Ground Assault® is a military-themed game where two to four players navigate challenging terrain, build structures to take control of land, and battle to defend their land.

The object of the game is to control six pieces of land at the same time across the battlefield before your opponents do the same. Each time you play, the tiles forming the battlefield are randomized, making each game a unique challenge!

A turn starts with 10 actions points that can be used in various ways. The most common ways to use the AP are moving troops around the board and using a combination of AP and skill cards to build something on a terrain tile which represents a piece of land. For instance, if you're on a river tile and you have the correct skill card (in this case the Engineer skill card) you can build a bridge across the river (you flip the tile over and the river becomes a bridge). Then you put your land control cube on the tile to mark that you own it.

The game ends for a specific player if they run out of troops. Troops can be lost in battles. The game ends altogether when one player acquires six pieces of land.

The catchphrase of the game is "Control the Field, Win the War." So it's all about maneuvering your troops around the battlefield (made up of terrain tiles), building structures to take control, and then defending them against attack.
With 100% hand-painted artwork by graphic novel illustrator Mark Woods-Hawkins and unique mechanics, Ground Assault® is a must have game in your collection!

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 6 - Jul 2021)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

It is I, James Introcaso, here to present ARCADIA 6. Check out that mind-bending cover by Nephelomancer. It is the stuff dreams (and some nightmares) are made of. Definitely Grade A ARCADIA awesome.

Inside ARCADIA 6:

The Grim Accord by Michael E. Shea
This article gives you four evil adventurer NPCs you can drop right into your game. These mercenaries make perfect rivals for your heroes and fight for gold and each other. Heavens help the party that crosses the Accord. Zuzanna Wuzyk illustrated each of these merciless mercenaries.

The Armor of Zevellon by Gabe Hicks
Gabe, who wrote “Titan Heart” in ARCADIA 1, returns with fantastic magic items! Each piece of this suit of magic plate armor gives the wearer incredible power. Collect them all to unleash the armor’s full power … and a fiendish surprise. Plus a short adventure for 6th-level characters is included in the article. MCDM staff artist Grace Cheung drew the art in this article.

Spelunking! by H.H. Carlan
This adventure sends 4th-level characters cave-diving to find a group of missing teens and face dangers unleashed by an ancient crystal monster. Art in this article comes from Miska Fredman, Faizal Fikiri, and Elisa Serio.

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 7 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
It’s James Introcaso coming back to bring you the first-ever themed issue of ARCADIA. That’s right. ARCADIA 7 is all about nature. I think this lush cover from Ian Ameling should get you feeling green… in a good way!

Inside ARCADIA 7:

The Pickling Guild by Sharang Biswas
The Guild of Pickling, Fermentation & Food Preservation is a network of eccentric culinary enthusiasts who enjoy experimenting at the intersection of alchemy and gastronomy… or so the public believes! This article includes the organization’s details and secrets, profiles of important NPC members, new food-themed magic items like sepulcheese, and a stat block for the Pickling Guild domain! The art in this article comes from Gustavo Pelissari and MCDM staff artist, Grace Cheung.

Wonders of the Wilds by Hannah Rose
Doesn’t it seem like wizards and fighters get all the coolest magic items while druids and rangers get diddly squat? Not anymore! “Wonders of the Wilds” features new nature-themed magic items, like the bag of saplings and staff of the seasons, and new spells for druids and rangers (and also sorcerers, warlocks, and wizards), like ice sheet and sandstorm. Kent Davis, Jr. and Nephelomancer did the art in this article.

Aethelfaer by Sara Thompson
Aethelfaer is a badass NPC ranger who could become friend or foe to the characters, depending on how they treat his forest. This article provides Aethelfaer’s story, statistics, plot hooks, and ready-to-play encounter with a bewitched unicorn! Art in this article comes from MCDM staff artist, Grace Cheung.

boardgame.name: The New Marvel-Phile (Issue 53)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In celebration of the release of Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings, we are proud to present the September issue of The New Marvel-Phile, featuring exciting new martial artist rules, and a bevy of profiles on your favorite martial artist heroes and villains!

boardgame.name: Infection
인펙션
boardgame.description:
Currently, various infectious diseases are spreading around the world. Players participate in the game as part of the CDC and must quarantine and treat infected patients in the most efficient way.

The goal of the game is to prevent the spread of infectious diseases among flares distributed in each city.

The first player in each round starts with a vaccine card. He throws all the dice and selects one set of the same scale dice in one color in the order of play and takes them.

Each round proceeds in the order of the next three steps.
dice rolling (infection and research), dice distribution (allocation), and worksheet writing (isolation and treatment).
All players share all the dice in order until they disappear, and fill out their own worksheet paper. (Players who take the dice must immediately record all the dice scales they took into the worksheet.) When all players finish writing the worksheet, the round ends with isolation treatment.

The next player will take the vaccine card and become the first player to proceed with the new round.

If the following situation occurs while playing several rounds, the game ends after playing the round: a player fills up both the infected patient and the vaccine treatment section in two wards, Or if a player O marks his third time in a space where he's in a worksheet or a shortage of hospital rooms.

When the game is over, the player with the highest total wins by calculating each of the following scores: Treatment score, infection patient score, vaccine treatment inventory score, infection eradication score, vaccine treatment acquisition rate score, and hospital room shortage score.

boardgame.name: Go, Gorilla!
boardgame.description:
Go Gorilla! is a balance game that promotes motor skills. Build a palm tree and place the monkey without the palm tree collapsing or being knocked over by the gorilla. There are 3 different game modes available: cooperative, against each other, or as a free game.


Go Gorilla! ist ein Balance-Spiel welches die motorischen Fähigkeiten fördert. Baue eine Palme und platziere den Affen, ohne dass die Palme einstürzt oder vom Gorilla umgeworfen wird. Es sind 3 verschiedene Spielmodi verfügbar: gemeinsam, gegeneinander oder als freies Spiel.

boardgame.name: Inherit
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Inherit is a solo journaling game where you write, draw, answer questions, and explore the journey of a cursed Object as it passes from Victim to Victim. Similar to stories like The Monkey's Paw, Jumanji, or The Portrait of Dorian Gray.
Misery, grief, and woe sound around you. You drop to the floor out of cold hands - cries of despair follow you as you’re thrown into the sea - you are locked away forever… until a new victim uncovers you once again. You are a cursed object.

You wait in darkness, on display, at the bottom of the lake, in the attic, until you are found.

Your victims might come upon you through acquaintance, inheritance, or pure ill luck. Your victims are how you experience the world, and all you remember is the terrible works your bring upon them.

Create your object, choose your curse, choose your victims! A handy cheat sheet is included.

boardgame.name: Stringers
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Inspired by the film "Nightcrawler". Spread propaganda, breed paranoia, and feed an obsession with death.

Play as a crew of desperate scoundrels equipped with spark-craft "plasmography" camera technology. Document the murders, scandals, and dark happenings of the city., then sell the story to the various corrupt papers of Duskvol.

A full crew playbook with a supplement, including GM advice, alternate payoff rules, new factions, and a list of stringer spark-craft tech.

boardgame.name: Mission: Cheese!
boardgame.description:
The game consists in the little ones going through various tests and thus receiving the portions of cheese necessary to win the game.

Cooperative game mode: all the kids play together to win the cheese portions before grandma comes home! Competitive: Through teams you have to try to win as many cheeses as possible before grandma comes home or when the cat's plate of cheese is emptied (=end of the game).

The rounded cube is dragged across the roof of the house and will randomly and magically appear from one of the lower doors, thus defining the color of the card that must be overcome to get the cheese. Red cards: Say one thing of the color. Green card: guess the shape. Blue card - imitate the sound of the animal that appears on the card.

When the mouse lands on the grandma space, she moves one space towards the front door. If the cube rolls through the cat door or the mouse lands on the cat, a portion of cheese is given back to the plate.

The game ends when Grandma comes home or the plate of cheese is empty. The person with the most cheese slices wins.



Das Spiel besteht darin, dass die Kleinsten verschiedene Tests durchsetzen und so die Käseportionen erhalten, die erforderlich sind, um das Spiel zu gewinnen.Kooperativer Spielmodus: Alle Kinder spielen zusammen, um die Käseportionen zu gewinnen, bevor die Oma nach Hause kommt! Wettbewerbsfähig: Durch Teams müssen Sie versuchen, möglichst viele Käse zu gewinnen, bevor die Oma nach Hause kommt oder wenn der Katzenteller aus Käse entleert wird (=SPielende).

Der abgerundete Würfel wird über das Dach des Hauses gezogen und wird zufällig und magisch von einer der unteren Türen erscheint und so die Farbe der Karte definiert, die überwunden werden muss, um den Käse zu erhalten.
Rote Karten: Eine Sache der Farbe auf der grünen Karte sagen: die Form der blauen Karte erraten - das Geräusch des Tieres, das auf der Karte erscheint, imitieren.

Wenn die Maus auf dem Oma-Feld landet, bewegt sich diese ein Feld in Richtung Haustür. Rollt der Würfel durch die Katzentür oder landet die Maus auf der Katze, wird dem Teller ein Käse zurückgegeben.

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Ordalia
boardgame.description:
Ordalia Cards represent specific tasks Mages must perform by the end of the game to prevent the Black Rose from gaining additional Power Points. Each Ordalia Card has two different tasks; each completed task will grant Power Points to both the Mage and the Black Rose, but if the Mage fails to perform any of his/her tasks, he/she will lose against the Black Rose.

Contains 24 Ordalia cards (12 in Italian and 12 in English)

boardgame.name: The Grass Crown
boardgame.description:
This second game in the Shields & Swords Ancients series recreates ten battles spanning nearly three hundred years of Roman history. As was the case with the first game, With It Or On It (2019), The Grass Crown is a fresh, innovative taken on familiar material. The primary unit of maneuver is a "Wing" which itself consists of ten or so individual counters. Losses can be resolved by flipping the individual unit that was attacked, or by flipping any unit adjacent to it. Unrelenting pressure in the right places can prompt a Rout Check, causing the line to collapse. As the result of a single attack, multiple units can find themselves in your dead pile.

This simple but compelling theme sees many variations thanks to special rules that chart the evolution of Roman warfare, and contrasts them with the rigid Greek Phalanx, the sophisticated army of Hannibal, and the ferocity of the Gauls.

The ten battles are: Heraclea, Asculum, Trebbia, Zama, Pydna, Second Citra, Vercellae, Pharsalus, Thapsus, and Munda.

listing.notes:
GAME ACCESSORY ONLY!
Premium canvas map game accessory for The Grass Crown.

boardgame.name: The Great Ace Attorney Chronicles
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Following the legal career of new attorney Ryunosuke, The Great Ace Attorney Chronicles is a double-pack collection with each game consisting of five murder-mystery cases. Players must investigate crime scenes, interview witnesses, and ultimately piece together the story of the who, what, why, and how in each case. Ryunosuke must then present his case in court, often going up against ruthless or corrupt opposing counsel.

The game is set in late 19th century Japan and England and includes some features to assist newcomers to the series. The story emphasizes humor and plot twists as you work to solve each case.

boardgame.name: Operación Backbone: La invasión aliada del Protectorado, 1942-1943
boardgame.description:
Operation Backbone is a wargame published in the magazine Alea (#37) simulating the hypothetical invasion of the Spanish Protectorate of Morocco, as a follow-up of Operation Torch in December 1942. The game is based in the contingency plans of the Allied staff should Spain, pressed by Germany, intervene militarily against Torch.

With a classical hex & counter "I go - you go" mechanics, the Allied player must control almost all cities in Spanish Morocco to win.

boardgame.name: Micro Cosmos
boardgame.description:
Micro Cosmos is a 1-4 player, card based, resource management game in which players try to terraform planets, create colonies and bring back survivors to their home worlds.

On each turn players move their spaceship (Ark), use their cards in one of 3 different ways in order to gain and convert resources and perform various actions on planets, moons and space stations. Players try to gain victory points by terraforming planets, scouting for survivors, settling them on their home worlds and creating colonies on planets they visit.

Once a set number of planets is fully terraformed, the player with the most victory points is considered the winner.

The game includes a robust solo mode that uses a super simple Automa deck to perform the AI players actions. Various levels of difficulty create a challenge for any player.
