boardgame.name: Barikarám
boardgame.description:
Barikarám (Sheepdogs)

A family game that even children can learn easily. Players act as sheepdogs whose goal is to gather the dispersed flock into the sheep pen, but while doing so, they must keep out intruders. The winner is the player who gathers the most sheep (and points) in the pen.

Each player has a personal board, with the sheep pen in the center. The game includes a pack of tiles showing groups of sheep or some other characters, such as a fox, a wolf, a hen or the farmer.

In the first phase, each player has the option to create a set of four tiles selected from a common stock, or to take one of the existing sets. In the second phase, they place one of their tiles on the board and move a tile to an adjacent space. If it is not empty, the tile (or row of tiles) is pushed ahead in the direction of the move. As a result, tiles are rearranged on the board and in the sheep-pen every turn. The goal is to push as many sheep as possible into the pen while keeping every other creature outside.
The game has 3 optional modules, which can be integrated into the gameplay either individually or together to enhance the challenge. The black sheep, if remains in the pen, earns points for the opponents. Trees block some of the spaces. The roosters can help move the worthless hens out of the way.

---
Magyar ismertető:

Ebben a gyerekek számára is könnyen érthető családi játékban juhászkutyaként be kell terelnünk a szétszéledt birkanyájat a karámba, miközben igyekszünk távol tartani minden haszontalan vagy káros elemet. A játék végén az nyer, aki a legtöbb birkát (és pontot) gyűjti össze a karámon belül.

Mindenki saját táblán játszik, melynek a legnagyobb részét a karám foglalja el. A játékhoz tartozik továbbá egy csomag lapka, benne különböző értékű birkacsoportokkal és más karakterekkel: rókával, farkassal, tyúkkal és a gazdával.

A játék első fázisában a játékosok sorrendben egy-egy négyes csoportot képeznek a véletlenszerűen kihelyezett lapkakészletből, vagy magukhoz vesznek egyet már meglévő csoportokból. A következő fázisban kihelyeznek egy-egy lapkát a saját táblájuk szélére, majd elmozgatnak egy bármilyen lapkát a szomszédos mezőre. Ha ez a mező nem üres, az ott lévő (és esetleges további) lapkák egy mezővel eltolódnak a mozgás irányában. Ezáltal a táblán – és így a karámban is – folyamatosan átrendeződnek a lapkák. A játékosok célja, hogy minél több birkát toljanak be a karámba, de minden más teremtmény kívül maradjon.

A játék 3 opcionális modullal rendelkezik, melyek egyenként vagy együtt beépítve a játékmenetbe fokozzák a kihívást. Ilyenek a fekete bárányok, amelyek ha a karámban maradnak, az ellenfeleknek hoznak pontot. A fák blokkolnak bizonyos mezőket, a kakasok viszont a lábatlankodó tyúkokat tarthatják távol.

boardgame.name: Regime Rumble: Pax Britannica Expansion
boardgame.description: This expansion adds 4 British leader miniatures (Margaret Thatcher, Winston Churchill, Henry VIII, and Elizabeth II), 1 corgi miniature, and 4 associated Clone Cards to the base game. The miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted.

boardgame.name: The Temple of Qultar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This short adventure covers a temple hidden deep in the mountains with a horrible past and an even more horrible present. Deadly, vicious and certainly a challenge to anyone that dares to enter, the temple is a place of horror and death. Adventure contains three new deadly creatures to toss at your players.

boardgame.name: The Storm Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ever wondered what power could be wroght by harnessing the strength of the elements themselves? What could you do with the might of a thunderstorm at your comand? Now think of the horrors that would occur if those powers were put in the wrong hands... say an efreeti with a grudge? Enter the Storm Keep and find out for yourselves...

The Storm Keep is a dungeon crawl adventure, designed to be played...by player characters of 3rd to 5th level.

boardgame.name: Hangar 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This pack contains 3 hangar maps in a similar theme. Each map is 34x22 squares and drawn for VTT but is also suitable for printing.

boardgame.name: Mushroom Cavern 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a cavern themed map pack featuring a numerous mushroom forests, underground pools, rivers and waterfalls. This is a quad map, 4 22x17 maps drawn and colored to be assembled into a larger 44x34 image. This pack contains 5 maps with various themes.

boardgame.name: SoroPlay GamTools Zine Special: Ghost Ref
boardgame.description:
From ghosts to possessions to spirits to specters to phantoms to poltergeists, incorporal supernatural beings haunt, possess, inhabit, visit, appear, and embody a particular place, object, or natural phenomena. This issue may be used for many settings such as ghost hunting, possession, haunted houses, haunted mansions, crypts, tombs, etc...

This even has a tool to help generate random adventure story scene synopsis or new dialogue based on interpreted results

boardgame.name: Dwarven Waterworks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Do you want to run a D&D adventure beneath a dwarven city?

This battlemap is perfect for an adventure where the party must navigate through an underground waterworks facility. The map comes with an adventure prompt that will allow you to easily run this adventure in one sitting! You can even use it as part of your campaign, if you’re feeling creative.

With this Dwarven Waterworks battlemap, you can create all sorts of exciting encounters for your players. Your party will be able to explore every nook and cranny of the map as they encounter enemies throughout their journey. It’s time to make sure that you have everything you need for another epic adventure!

boardgame.name: Overgrown Wellspring Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a new temple battlemap?
I’ve got you covered! This beautiful battlemap is perfect for your next encounter with monsters or dangerous traps while searching for hidden treasure. You can print it out with an easy-to-use .PDF or put the .JPEGs in your favorite VTT, like Roll20, Fantasy Grounds or MapTool. Either way, this map will be a wonderful addition to your game!
If you're looking for a new adventure, this is the place. You'll find all sorts of things here—from urns filled with strange items to hidden treasure chests. There are even rumors that there may be something waiting inside the temple itself... but you'll have to explore it in order to find out!
Grab this map and see what awaits you and your players at this beautiful location.

boardgame.name: Forest Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This forest is lush and green, with a deep gully running through it. Alongside the river grow strange, prickly plants with red flowers, while further out broad-leaved plants and shrubbery form the forest’s undergrowth.
Crumbling stone outcrops leave piles of rubble strewn about the ground.

boardgame.name: Desert Gully
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A deep desert gully with a small stream running through it. The surrounding wasteland is barren and dry, filled with sand and crumbling stone from the rocky outcrops.
Alongside the river grow prickly plants, as hostile as this land and known as Prophet’s Roses. Their blossoms are red.

boardgame.name: Ravenloft Player's Compendium
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sixty-five subclasses, plus feats, spells, and more for the Domains of Dread and beyond.

boardgame.name: The Lost Citadel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Seven decades ago, there were cities upon cities, kingdoms and nations. Cultures at war and at trade.
Humans, dwarves, elves, and others.
So it remained for millennia, through two vibrant ages called ascensions.
Until the world ended.
Nations crumbled. Magic sputtered.
Nature sickened. Civilizations died.
The dead woke.

boardgame.name: Lost Citadel Roleplaying (Screen)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A six-panel, landscape orientation screen, with three pages art and three pages tables.

boardgame.name: Wildjammer: More Adventures in Space
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Imagine that you're standing on your favorite D&D world. All around you, there might be forests, swamps, mountains, bogs, ruins, cities, and more. Beneath your feet, there are countless labyrinthine tunnels and cave systems, perhaps even the Underdark. Whether you’re traveling along your favorite D&D world’s surface or in the caverns below, we have a good idea of how to run a game in that environment.

Now what we if we look up? Sure, there might be a cloud city, but I mean what if we look way up? What if we look up at a star and wonder what’s up there? How do we go there? You might try flying, but you don't make it far before the spell fails and exhaustion takes over. Perhaps an airship? How does your airship fly when the air of the upper atmosphere begins to thin? Is this some insuperable barrier to exploration?

Absolutely not.

Wildjammer is a setting neutral rule-set inspired by the D&D campaign setting Spelljammer, created by Jeff Grubb and published by TSR, Inc. in 1989 as the flagship setting for D&D 2nd edition. Spelljammer gave us the means to bring our adventures up into space without losing any of the essential fantasy of D&D. It envisioned a universe structured in such a way that all D&D settings could be navigable without the rules or unique character of one setting hampering another. Your character from Faerun (Forgotten Realms) could travel into space and find Oerth (Greyhawk) or Krynn (Dragonlance), or any other setting the DM decides to add. The goal of this Wildjammer is much the same: to offer a rule-set that can be used in a D&D 5th edition game to unite different settings and do so in a way that doesn’t hamper the essential fantasy flavor of D&D.

boardgame.name: Steven Universe
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Las Gemas de Cristal te ayudan si estás mal

Granate, Amatista, Perla ... ¡y Steven! te abren las puertas a su fantástico mundo para que puedas vivir tus propias aventuras junto a todos los fascinantes personajes de la serie.

¡Tú decides! Puedes interpretar a alguna de las protagonistas de Steven Universe, crear tu propia gema o cualqu ier otro personaje que puedas imag inar, visitar los pintorescos rincones de Beach City o explorar las ruinas dejadas en lo Tierra por las gemas, lanzarte a explorar el espacio exterior u otras dimensiones, disfrutar de historias breves y desenfadadas o sumarte a la épica batalla contra la Gran Autoridad Diamantina. 10 usar todo eso junto!

boardgame.name: Sueños Fritos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

De 3 a 5 jugadoras | 2 horas de juego

Hay algo estupendo en las historias de Steven Universe a la hora de combinar la más sencilla intimidad de sus personajes con momentos de alta fantasía y acción desenfrenada. En Sueños fritos te proponemos un poco de todo eso de la mano de las Gemas de Cristal y el siempre paranoico Ronaldo Fryman. Nunca estuvieron tan cerca la comida y las ganas de comer.

boardgame.name: InfiniteD20 Roleplaying Game Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

InfiniteD20 Roleplaying Game Engine is an extremely rules-light, generic, universal, roleplaying set of guidelines. It is a retroclone of XD20 Roleplaying System.

This new expression of the rules is concise, straightforward, and a great way to introduce new players to the roleplaying hobby.

boardgame.name: Children of the Dragon, Draconic Player Races and Subclasses
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Children of the Dragon is a homebrew supplement for Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition, with a focus on dragons and dragon themed content.

In this book you will find both revised and new playable draconic races for your campaign, including the dragonborn, half dragon, kobold and lizardfolk. You will also find new draconic subclasses, for your favorite main classes.

Additional content includes new dragons, new magic items, new spells, and a summary of forgotten lore. So that you can add more dragons into your Dungeons & Dragons adventures.

boardgame.name: Der Trötofanten-Zirkus
boardgame.description:
Look and be amazed: the world's largest elephant circus is in town!

All the great elephants want to thrill the spectators with their tricks – but the tootophants are the real stars! You've never heard of tootophants? They are a very rare breed of elephants with golden trumpet noses that are much louder than their fellow elephants with trunks. Now the elephant circus is looking for a new circus director, because every animal would like to have the ring to itself – and there's a lot of confusion! Which one of you can collect the most elephants and tootophants and play the “trumpet” to his fellow players?

Build your own elephant circus in Der Trötofanten-Zirkus! To do this, at the end of the game you must have as many elephants and tootophants in front of you that are happy with you as circus director and follow you voluntarily. In the scoring, each animal lying open in front of you counts as +1 point.

At the beginning of each game round, each player draws a card from the edge of the ring and keeps it face down in his hand. In a clockwise direction, each player now takes a turn. Only when the player to your right has completed his turn, you show your card to your fellow players and take your action.

The game ends immediately when the last card has been drawn from the edge of the circus ring and applied. Now it is time for the scoring, and the points are counted. The player with the most points wins!

DER TRÖTOFANTEN-ZIRKUS Einfach, rasant, spaßig! Der weltgrößte Elefantenzirkus ist in der Stadt. Wirst du der oder die neue Zirkusdirektor*in?
Ihr habt noch nie von Trötofanten gehört? Das sind ganz besonders seltene Elefanten mit goldener Trötennase, die noch viiieeel lauter sind als ihre Artgenossen mit Rüssel. Nun sucht der Elefantenzirkus einen neuen Zirkusdirektor, denn jedes Tier möchte die Manege am liebsten für sich allein – und es herrscht großes Durcheinander! Wer von euch kann die meisten Elefanten und Trötofanten sammeln und seinen Mitspielern ordentlich eine »tröten«?
Die Spieler bilden mit den Karten eine Manege – und dann geht’s schon rund: Tiere mit gleichen Stärken werden gesammelt oder die Stapel der Mitspieler durch lautes Tröten geklaut. Für noch mehr Trubel sorgen Mäuse und die Mausefalle – und für Abwechslung die beiliegenden Erweiterungssets Dompteure und Lassos. Ein bunter Spaß für Klein und Groß. TRÖÖÖT!!!
Spielinhalt: 99 Spielkarten (incl. 2 Erweiterungen) 1 Übersicht 2 Spielregeln
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN

boardgame.name: Tassar & Morrhår (1st Ed)
boardgame.description: The players play small animals in anything from very realistic to full anthropomorphic fantasy settings. A realistic world description is included as well as tips for making your own worlds.

boardgame.name: Imperium: Classics – The GiftForge Insert
boardgame.description:
Compatible with:
Imperium Classics

Details:
Tested with premium sleeved cards.
This product does not require assembly.

Insert size: 17,7 cm x 26 cm x 7 cm.
The product won't lift the lid.
Material: 3 mm birch wood.

boardgame.name: Lisbon Tram 28: One way promo cards
boardgame.description:
Expand your "Lisbon Tram 28" game with these 4 new special places to visit:

Card #1 - Sta. Justa
Card #2 - Bica
Card #3 - Lavra
Card #4 - Glória

boardgame.name: Show what you know
Ukaž, co umíš
boardgame.description:
Czech board game about knowledge. This game was to test children's knowledge in a fun way. The children are accompanied by a pioneer who shows them the correct answers to the questions.

Translation of the name is "Show what you know".

Description of components and game mechanism:
The game contains a playing area, which is divided into two equally large circles. One circle contains questions on its perimeter - and the other circle contains answers to those questions. In total, the game contains 8 sets of questions and answers to various knowledge topics. The questions are from topics: technology, physics, history, sports, riddles and knowledge of Czechoslovakia.

The game also contains one figure that depicts a child pioneer (scout), who has a wand in his hand and points it to the ground - to questions and answers. The figure can be rotated in the base.

At the beginning of the game, players choose one game board with questions and place it in the game box. The player then places the pioneer piece in the center of the question circle (the pioneer pedestal fits into the recess) and the player turns the pioneer stick to the question he wants to answer. The player then tries to answer the question. Players take turns and count points for correctly answered questions. The winning player who answered the most questions correctly.

boardgame.name: Glory & Galleons
Glory&Galleons
boardgame.description:
The game is set in a fantasy medieval realm where the battles take place in the air. Each player is a commander of a galleon fleet that floats in the air thanks to special crystals and balloons.

Every fleet has unique deck of cards. There are three location cards on the table. Each round players add their cards to these locations. At the end of a round, the scores are calculated and one of the player gets domination in the specific location. By covering special icons on the cards, players receive extra bonuses.

During battles players receive Victory Points. Whoever has the most VPs at the end of the game is the winner.

There is very clever variant for 1 player included.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Come: Deliverance – The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Enter the Lands of the Bohemian Crown at the onset of the Hussite wars. In times like these, trust is scarce, and faith is shaken. It is a conflict of religious beliefs that turns brother against brother, and it is the common man who pays the toll. Whether you hide in the deepest cellar or the tallest tower of a monastery, the flames of war will reach you there too. Tread lightly -- and godspeed!

Kingdom Come: Deliverance - The Board Game is a 1-4 player cooperative campaign app-driven board game that brings the Lands of the Bohemian Crown to your table! Live through the harrowing times and immerse yourself in this epic narrative journey in the Holy Roman Empire.

Throughout the campaign, you will be able to develop your characters and encounter new challenges on your journey. Each scenario in a campaign is a completely unique experience, bringing you to new locations and introducing new people. The game features a living world that remembers - characters will react to your actions, and you’ll be able to observe their behavior. But don’t waste your time - guards are patrolling at every step, so tread lightly, because they’re not keen on people like you.

The app will give you all the information you need for every scenario - from the setup to the tear-down. As you enter each location, you’ll be greeted with a rich world to explore, and it is up to you to decide where to go first. Throughout the game, you’ll be accompanied by an adaptive sound design - your actions will not only alter the story, but also the vast soundscapes. Every dialog and conversation is professionally voice acted, immersing you in the world even more.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nutmeg in the Dark
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Nutmeg in the Dark is a standalone adventure written in Knave, though any OSR system will work.

Something has happened to the northern mountain pass, those who have survived to return reported the smell of nutmeg before their party was ambushed in the dark.

The town guard is raising a party to go clear the pass. He enters the local tavern to conscript all the patrons, PCs will be generated from this group. (I thought this was an interesting use of the you meet in a tavern trope.) When PCs die they come out of the citizen pool. 9 characters, The guard, the players and NPC citizen soldiers, are active to fight, the rest hang out in back, waiting their turn to join when someone dies.

boardgame.name: Sucesos Argentinos – Expansión: Tus Sucesos
boardgame.description: In the exclusive expansion Tus Sucesos, you will be able to add the most important events of your life.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 1 – Gobiernos y Conflictos
Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 2 – Economía y Sociedad
Sucesos Argentinos: Volumen 3 – Ciencia y Cultura

boardgame.name: Last One Standing
boardgame.description:
Last One Standing is a snake-like game in which each player has two pawns to move around on the board using cards and tile abilities. Once you cannot move, you are out. The game ends when only one player is left.

On your turn, you will play a card from your hand, determining how many spaces to move. Before you play the card, you are allowed to play a tile from your hand.

Whenever you move a piece, you will flip the tile it just left, which may have an effect.

boardgame.name: Dwarves (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sundara is a vast world filled with a huge number of creatures. In Species of Sundara we explore some of the more common creatures, their unique cultures, and the differing variations they display.

The series began with elves, and now it’s time to move onto dwarves.

The children of the ancient giants, made by the primordial race to help finish the world they had such a hand in crafting, dwarves come in quite a large variety. From the slab-shouldered hillfolk of the Gannar’Gon, to the mountain sages of the Hasrada, and the rarely-seen swamp-dwelling Kraskar, these are only some of the dwarven cultures and clans that exist all across Sundara! In addition to an explanation of their cultural traditions and general society, each of the five different dwarven variations also has unique mechanics and background options to bring to your table!

Lastly, as with other Sundara releases, the dwarves in this book can be used as part of the growing Sundara setting, or integrated into your own, ongoing game!
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 14 - Aug 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue 14 - Venetian Theme
Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Outline map and overview of the city of Venetia - a fantasy city styled after medieval Venice
Game Advice - 5 Top tips on running in-game politics
Game Advice - How diagrams as hand-outs are a GM's best friend and how to use masks to create new circumstances for the players
New Deity - Rivagio, Lord of Giving. An outline of the gods background and his influence on the city.
Events - Outline of the rules governing duels in Venetia and a magic item that makes it possible for even a lowly peasant to fight a player character
Events - 3 carnivals outlined.
Organisations - 3 organisations presented including the main Venetian religion, a criminal organisation and a radical political group
8 Detailed NPCs including merchants who are not all they seem, a drunken nobleman who might be more than he seems and several people with devious political agendas
5 Magic mask including one with five variations and details of how each variation can be used in raising the dead, spell casting and ritual casting.
Artits Spotlight - Featuring Roman Murzabaev or to use his artists name s0ulafein
4 Unique locations (plus a means of transport around the city) - the locations feature vampires, questionable merchants and tragidy (plus books)
Creative Challenge - a reader has a creative problem, do you have the solution?
Unexpected - a way to derail your players egotistical assumptions by giving them a gondala to sail!
Picture Prompt - designed to get you thinking creatively

boardgame.name: The Oracle (Issue 15 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Oracle Issue 15 - CaravanTheme
Just as all characters are better equipped when they have a bag of holding, a potion of healing and a sunrod, a GM is better equipped when supplied with a steady stream of new material and ideas.

And that's what we have for you here.

This month we bring you, in one fully illustrated PDF the following system-neutral Fantasy RPG material:

Contents

Game Advice - Caravan Culture - mindset, key individuals, using scouting in your game and wagon types
Prophetic Vision - Using divination in your games using prophesy points
game Advice - How prophesy can be used to further your game
Events - Welcome Feast, The Big Show and The Oracles Tent
Advice on ways to use The Big Show in your games
7 Detailed NPCs including a young wanna be half orc acrobat, a dodgy merchant and a missing beast master amongst others
3 New magic items
Music and magic - suggestions on creating five different types of bardic rituals
Steeds - looking at more than just horses, and five different examples provided
10 Card Tarot - bespoke tarot cards to use in your games with two options for use
Gods of the Road - two new deities that your party might meet on the roads
Merchants - story hooks relating to merchant caravans and advice on an emergency side quest to keep ready
Secret Ways - how caravan travellers might use magic
12 Trinkets and treasure
Unexpected - suggestions on an unexpected event to trip up your players
Picture Prompt - designed to get you thinking creatively

boardgame.name: The Gourmand
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feed your friends and feast on your foes!

Study under the finest chefs of Tyr na Nog and Hell Itself!

Ethically harvest slimes and the undead while breaking multiple health code violations!

The Gourmand is Dungeon World class that harnesses the power of food. Whether by eating monster parts to gain their powers or by crafting more magnificent and bizarre delicacies to impress and empower your allies, the Gourmand is as welcome a friend as they are horrific a foe!

boardgame.name: The Martial Artist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Violence is the sweetest science!

Eschewing the mysticism and, frankly, outdated Orientalism of some other martial arts based classes, The Martial Artist borrows from a braod range of inspirations. From ancient Greek and modern wrestling, to boxing, Muay Thai and MMA, to 90's arcade games just because they're fun.

Furthermore, the Martial Artist boasts a system of fighting with a variety closer to a wizard's spellbook than a fighter's moveset.

All in all, the Martial Artist is a showstopping, face breaking champion!

boardgame.name: The Planetouched
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Progeny of mortals and beings from the elemental planes. Though reproducing with a planar being is almost impossible to do on accident, the planes never truly leave a bloodline and can create a planetouched baby well into posterity. The planetouched themselves vary considerably, even within their own element but tend to have strong bodies, old souls and great destinies.

This volume contains

Heritages for ifrits, oreads, syphs and undines
16 ancestry feats
A bit of planar lore

boardgame.name: The Dhampir
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Children of mortals and vampires, or perhaps the result of a pregnant mortal infected by a vampire. Almost nothing is known of the exact nature of the dhampir, owing to both the secrecy of vampires and the low survival rate of the unfortunate mothers. It goes without saying that dhampir rarely have happy childhoods.

Even those who do not see dhampir as wicked abominations tend to see them as miserable and broody company. Even so, if one ever does get under a dhampir's icy exterior they can prove to be exceedingly loyal companions with magnificent inner strength.

boardgame.name: The Robber Knight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Honor. Justice. Charity. These are the old tenets of chivalry: a code as close to death as everything else in this world. There are however, rumored to be a few true knights left who follow the old ways and live only to punish the wicked and ease the suffering of the good; and as long as they never show up you’ll be able to loot and pillage the defenseless to your heart’s content...

all for your lord of course.

boardgame.name: The Kobald
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kobalds are a short, furry people with canine like heads and metallic teeth. They are most famous (and reviled) for their ability to eat iron, gold, silver and other precious metals and excrete cobalt (hence the name).

boardgame.name: The Arquebusier
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The arquebus (also called tamagashina by the samurai and tüfek by the janissaries) is a strange and chaotic weapon for a strange and chaotic age. The arquebus is slow to reload, impossible to fire when wet and it boasts a range and accuracy laughable to any seasoned archer. Yet it terrifies the ruling classes.

Any peasant's child big enough to hold an arquebus can, with a few days training and a lot of nerve, kill a king a 100 yards away at the speed of thunder. An arquebusier can turn the finest platemail into a smoking tomb. It may even break the hegemony of magic on the world

boardgame.name: Chosen Wielder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chosen wielders are chosen by a higher power (usually a goddess, sorceress or shrine maiden) to wield a mystic weapon (usually but not always a sword).

Chosen wielders are given their weapons by their patrons to achieve a great quest or even as a seal of holy authority. In the end, however, it is the wielder who decides the fate of the weapon as well as their own fate.

boardgame.name: Villains (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‐hearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‐cloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‐up including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat block and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

boardgame.name: Villains (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‐hearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‐cloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‐up including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat block and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

boardgame.name: Villains (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every hero needs an antihero, every defender of the light must have darkness to keep at bay and every pure‐hearted paladin needs a vile, shadow‐cloaked assassin to cut down. Villains presents seven such malign foes to bedevil your heroes. Each villain benefits from an extensive write‐up including notes on their background, personality, mannerisms and distinguishing marks as well as a fully detailed stat block and plot hooks making it easy to insert the villain into almost any campaign.

boardgame.name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings – Hundred Kingdoms Household Knights Regiment Set
boardgame.description:
Following the sweeping reforms of Charles Armatellum at the onset of his conquests, the ceremony of dubbing can only be performed by an Imperial noble of at least the rank of Margrave or Count Palatine. The anointment, moreover, can only take place after a battle in which the prospective knight has blooded his blade. These mandates were established to ensure that only men of true prowess earned the rank of Knight. Even with the Empire dissolved, those mandates are well preserved traditions and those who ignore them meet ridicule. In fact, a recurring article presented in the Imperial Conclaves is the appointment of Counts Palatine, to replace those who may have fallen in battle or died or old age.

The massed charge of Household Knights is one of the most powerful weapons at the disposal of a Hundred Kingdoms commander. Hundreds of pounds of obdurate metal and muscle, forged through years of training and experience, they have shattered men, formations, and kingdoms throughout the ages.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings

boardgame.name: Koruru: New Zealand
boardgame.description:
Koruru, also known as Knuckle-Bones, is a game of dexterity, already played in ancient times with stones or animal bones. This is the Maori version.

Basically, you take all pieces in one hand, throw them into the air and try to catch as many as you can with the back of your hand. Then you throw the caught pieces up again and try to catch at least one of them with your palm. This is the „Taw“ stone; if you caught more than one piece, select one for Taw. The Taw is then used for several variants.

boardgame.name: Through the Walls of Mist and Thorn: Patrons of the Faery Chaos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

5 Fair Princesses, patrons for your DCC game, preside over the everchanging chaos of Fairy where they plot escape, completion...or your consumption. A complete guide to the Faery Chaos, a different kind of Fairyland. A fickle and changeable realm of deep magic, long memory, and infinite time. Treasures, spells, lore, and both travel and story generators for those inevitable mad quests into the Fairy realms.

AND GOBLINS SO MANY GOBLINS

Chaos magic, deep time,, the first changeling. A traditional yet quite psychedelic interpretation of the world's legends extrapolated in weird new directions. NOt what your players will expect.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: The Scumbag's Guide to Scrapbridge
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

WELCOME TO SCRAPBRIDGE!
One of the rare bright spots in the Wasteland, Scrapbridge attracts roamers and wanderers, just like trash does rustmoths. Not only can anything and everything be had for a few bullets, but Scrapbridge offers safety and security from the never-ending parade of violence that defines so much of life out in the wilds. The appeal of having a place to let down your guard means ever faction respects the commnunity’s rules, and here you’ll find V Reichers haunting the same watering holes as mutants, junkers dickering over the price of an evening’s entertainment in Bridge’s seedier quarters, and gangers slapping skin with their sworn enemies who, just a week prior, they were fighting against for their lives.

The first sourcebook for PunkApocalyptic: The RPG, the Scumbag’s Guide to Scrapbridge offers an in-depth look at the most important outpost in the Wasteland. You’ll find expanded descriptions of every neighborhood, details on cool places to visit, powerful friends to make, and hooks for all kinds of missions.

In addition, the book comes loaded with new background. You can now be a teacher’s pet, join the La Trini gang, or root around through the old sewers with the other tunnel wackos.

Finally, this book reveals a selection of terrible and nasty things you might find in and around Scrapbridge. From the hulking mouthers to the cute and devastating punkicorns, you can kill these things or be killed by them. Rounding out this section are a number of mercenaries you might fight or hire as you make your way through the Wastelands.

A perfect expansion to one of the downright dirtiest, ugliest post-apocalyptic tabletop RPGs, it’s filled with charming writing and evocative art. You know you want it.

This product is intended for people who can navigate frequent f-bombs, disgusting concepts, and who possess a juvenile sense of humor. If this doesn’t sound like you, skip the book as no one wants to deal with your complaints.

boardgame.name: Everdell: Expo Hall
boardgame.description:
Promotional Card made available at the Tabletop Tycoon booth at GenCon 2021

Unique Construction
Governance (Blue)
Cost: 2 Twigs, 1 Resin, 1 Pebble
Worth: 2 Base Points

"After you play a Construction, you may give an opponent 1 Card to Gain 1 Point and Draw 1 Card."

This is an alternate artwork card for City Hall found in Everdell: Newleaf.

boardgame.name: Kinderpulok
boardgame.description: The players should lay out picture cards on their game board according to the chosen rule variant. At the beginning of the game, players are given a certain number of picture cards and lay them out on the given places on their board. During the game, players receive new picture cards and exchange more usable ones for the ones already on the board until the target pattern is met.

boardgame.name: Puppet Masters
boardgame.description:
Puppet Masters is a game where players choose from 27 Masters, powerful characters with differing amounts of health or magical prowess, each with special abilities encouraging a certain style of play. Then the players each pick up to two decks from the 18 different factions ranging from undead to angels to steampunk. All chosen decks by all players are shuffled together into a single draw pile, from which the minions, Puppets, are drawn into the arena. These can be bought and used by the players or hunted for money, money which can be spent on spells of destruction or items to buff Puppets. It is a flexible game, addictive, easy to learn but hard to master and fits up to 4 players in free for all or 2v2 formats.

The single draw pile is to guarantee all players have access to all things in the game. If there is something directly counter to your strategy in the game in play, you can either buy it up so your opponent can’t use it or destroy it before they get it. Players can attack each other, each other’s Puppets, or the Puppets in the arena. The replay value of this game is very high due to the massive amount of combinations in the game of Masters and Puppets, plus the different strategies of gaining many cheap puppets or getting just one or two very strong ones and giving them a lot of items, or anything in between.

There are four phases of each turn, during which Players can perform different actions. In the recovery phase players receive gold and replenish their Puppets' energy, and the maintenance phase they can take turns buying items and spells for the upcoming battle. In the possession phase, players bid on Puppets to control using their Master character's strings (a finite resource moved around throughout the battle to control Puppets), the player with the highest bid on a Puppet gets it as their own. Then, finally, the action phase, where players use spells and Puppets to attack each other. Player turns in each round are infinite as long as you have things to do. This is limited instead by money/strings/Puppet strength to perform actions.

The game ends when there is only one player/team left in the game.

The winner is the last Player/Team remaining on the field. If a player is reduced to 0 hit points, they are out of the game.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable
